NewsLine.NewsLineText: SPORT-SOCCER-CHAMPIONS-GROUPS:Soccer-Champions League matches in groups E and F, Sept 24

body.p: LONDON, Sept 23 (Reuters) - Newcastle United entertain Dutch UEFA Cup holders Feyenoord and Ukraine's Dynamo Kiev tackle Italian side Juventus in Turin in Tuesday's group E Champions League action.
In group F Manchester United travel to Germany to face Bayer Leverkusen, while Greek side Olympiakos Piraeus play Maccabi Haifa of Israel in Cyprus.
Following are brief previews with probable teams for Tuesday's matches (kickoff 1845 GMT):
Group E
NEWCASTLE UNITED v FEYENOORD
Newcastle manager Bobby Robson will seek to secure his club's first Champions League group E points with the same side that overcame local rivals Sunderland 2-0 on Saturday.
That means wingers Laurent Robert and Nolberto Solano will be in the team, having both started on the substitutes' bench when Newcastle began their campaign with a 2-0 defeat at Dynamo Kiev.

There is no place for French left back Olivier Bernard, who was omitted from the squad at the weekend, and Hugo Viana will have to be content with a place on the bench. Northern Ireland defender Aaron Hughes will operate on the left with Andy Griffin at right back.
Newcastle: 1-Shay Given; 12-Andrew Griffin, 34-Nikos Dabizas, 5-Andy O'Brien, 18-Aaron Hughes; 4-Nolberto Solano, 8-Kieron Dyer, 11-Gary Speed, 32-Laurent Robert; 10-Craig Bellamy, 9-Alan Shearer.

Feyenoord coach Bert van Marwijk has to do without left back Ramon van Haaren, who sustained a hamstring injury in Saturday's league match against Graafschap Doetinchem, which the UEFA Cup winners won 2-0.
Van Haaren is expected to be out for up to four weeks and is likely to be replaced by Poland international Thomasz Rzasa.

Youngster Robin van Persie, who was banished temporarily to the reserves after the coach said he had behaved unprofessionally, returned last week and travels with the team to Newcastle. Captain Paul Bosvelt, who missed their opening 1-1 group E draw against Juventus after his father died, is also back.

Feyenoord: 1-Edwin Zoetebier; 23-Brett Emerton, 8-Kees van Wonderen, 17-Patrick Paauwe, 3-Thomasz Rzasa; 24-Chong-gug Song; 6-Paul Bosvelt, 14-Shinji Ono, 25-Sebastian Pardo; 9-Pierre van Hooijdonk, 19-Thomas Buffel.
Referee: Claude Colombo (France)
JUVENTUS v DYNAMO KIEV
Juventus midfielder Alessio Tacchinardi is doubtful after suffering soreness in his left hamstring following Saturday's Serie A match against Empoli.

In attack, though, the team is reaching full strength with Alessandro Del Piero and Marco Di Vaio starting up front and last season's top scorer David Trezeguet expected to start from the bench after recovering from injury.

Juventus: 1-Gianluigi Buffon; 21-Lilian Thuram, 13-Mark Iuliano, 4-Paolo Montero, 24-Emiliano Moretti; 16-Mauro Camoranesi, 26-Edgar Davids, 3-Alessio Tacchinardi (or 20-Davide Baiocco); 11-Pavel Nedved; 10-Alessandro Del Piero, 18-Marco Di Vaio.

Dynamo team officials say one change is likely to the squad after last week's impressive victory over Newcastle, with Laszlo Bodnar replacing Leandro. Bodnar performed well in Dynamo's otherwise disappointing 1-1 weekend draw against outsiders Obolon Kiev in the Ukrainian premier league.
Also a doubtful starter is Florin Cernat, who is recovering from a groin injury. He may be replaced by Goran Gavrancic.

"We must not allow ourselves to be lulled into a euphoric state after the Newcastle victory -- that was only the first match in the whole tournament," Dynamo Kiev vice-president Josef Sabo, the team's former coach, told Kommanda newspaper.

Dynamo: 12-Vitaly Reva, 2-Alexander Khatskevich, 26-Andriy Nesmachniy, 35-Goran Sablic, 36-Jerko Leko, 10-Florin Cernat (or 32-Goran Gavrancic), 11-Georgy Peev, 14-Andriy Husin, 16-Maxim Shatskikh, 17-Tiberiu Ghioane, 24-Laszlo Bodnar.
Referee: Wolfgang Stark (Germany)
Group F
BAYER LEVERKUSEN v MANCHESTER UNITED
Leverkusen lost 3-2 at Werder Bremen on Saturday on the back of their embarrassing 6-2 thrashing by Olympiakos Piraeus in their group F opener last Wednesday in Athens.
Last season's Bundesliga runners-up and Champions League finalists are now fourth from bottom in the German league standings with three defeats from six games.

Coach Klaus Toppmoeller, whose team knocked out Manchester United in the semi-finals last season, has to make do without defenders Jens Nowotny and Diego Placente, both sidelined with long-term injuries.

"United are clearly the favourites and that's an advantage for us," said Toppmoeller, who dropped first choice goalkeeper Hans-Joerg Butt for his team's last two games. Australian Frank Juric, who stepped in for Butt, is expected to play again on Tuesday.

Leverkusen: 20-Frank Juric; 6-Boris Zivkovic, 3-Lucio, 28-Carsten Ramelow, 17-Pascal Ojigwe; 14-Hanno Balitsch, 15-Jurica Vrantjes, 25-Bernd Schneider, 10-Yildiray Basturk; 23-Thomas Brdaric, 27-Oliver Neuville.
United are still beset by injury problems for their trip to Germany. Midfielders Roy Keane (hip) and Paul Scholes (knee) both miss out along with Wes Brown (broken ankle).
Right back Gary Neville (foot) is fit to return after making a 15-minute appearance during last Saturday's 1-0 premier league win over Tottenham Hotspur.

Manchester United: 1-Fabien Barthez; 2-Gary Neville, 5-Laurent Blanc, 6-Rio Ferdinand, 27-Mikael Silvestre; 7-David Beckham, 8-Nicky Butt, 4-Juan Sebastian Veron, 11-Ryan Giggs; 20-Ole Gunnar Solskjaer, 10-Ruud van Nistelrooy.
Referee: Jan Wegereef (Netherlands)
MACCABI HAIFA v OLYMPIAKOS PIRAEUS
Maccabi suffered a fright on Sunday when central midfielder Walid Badir hurt his foot in a training session in Israel before the squad flew to Cyprus, where Tuesday's game is taking place.
Defensive midfielder Raimondas Zautautas, who missed last week's 5-2 loss to Manchester United, is still nursing a knee injury and may sit out the start of the match.
Nigerian striker Ayegbeni Yakubu makes a welcome return from suspension.

Maccabi: 44-Dudu Awate; 3-Alon Harazi, 4-Arik Benado, 14-Eric Ejiafor, 6-Adoram Keise; 5-Walid Badir, 11-Giovanni Rosso, 28-Nenad Pralija, 2-Raimondas Zautautas or 13-Michael Zandberg; 19-Ayegbeni Yakoubu, 20-Yaniv Katan.

Olympiakos have doubts over the fitness of goalkeeper Dimitris Eleftheropoulos (back) and winger Stelios Giannakopoulos (thigh). Eleftheropoulos has not trained with the squad since their 6-2 win over Bayer Leverkusen, while Giannakopoulos missed their 4-0 win on Saturday over Akratitos.
Greece striker Lambros Houtos returns to the squad after a two-week absence with a calf injury.

Olympiakos: 22-Fanis Kateryiannakis, 2-Christos Patsatzoglou, 3-Stelios Venetidis, 18-Paraskevas Antzas, 32-Giorgos Anatolakis, 7-Stelios Giannakopoulos, 8-Christian Karembeu, 11-Predrag Djordjevic, 13-Ze Elias, 20-Par Zetterberg, 10-Giovanni.
Referee: Massimo De Santis (Italy)
